title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
16:58 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
16:58 <vmassol> !search Building  
16:58 <vmassol> !help  
16:58 <vmassol> hmmm  
16:58 <vmassol> sburjan: here: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Building  
16:58 <vmassol> you need to have your settings.xml as described there  
16:59 <vmassol> (this was changed last week)  
16:59 <+sburjan> oh, forbot about the maven central push  
16:59 <+sburjan> \*forgot  
16:59 <+sburjan> my bad  
17:00 <+sburjan> worked like a charm :)  
17:01 <evalica> has quit  
17:02 <+sburjan> vmassol: I see you made a huge refactoring to the ui-tests. you split the po and tsets in 2 diferent modules  
17:02 <+tmortagne> sburjan: did  
17:02 <+tmortagne> I did  
17:02 <+sburjan> I see  
17:02 <+tmortagne> goal being to reuse the framework for other projects  
17:03 <+tmortagne> like WYSIWYG, LDAP, etc.  
17:03 <+sburjan> good idea  
17:03 <+tmortagne> (or anyone else)  
17:03 <+sburjan> and now we have a very clear delimitation between po's and tests  
17:03 <+tmortagne> yep  
17:03 <+tmortagne> that too :)  
17:04 <+sburjan> but still, po's can only be used at ui-tests, right ?  
17:04 <+tmortagne> why ?  
17:04 <+sburjan> so ATM the only other submodule benefiting from this is wysiwyg-tests and  
17:05 <+sburjan> that \_could\_ benefit  
17:05 <+tmortagne> I just listed LDAP too  
17:05 <+tmortagne> I could also list XWiki Repository tests and XEM tests too  
17:05 <+sburjan> LDAP isn't only unit/functional ?  
17:05 <+tmortagne> LDAP also have UI tests  
17:05 <+tmortagne> it actually have all sort of automated tests :)  
17:06 <+sburjan> oh yes, but it's Selenium 1 ui-test  
17:06 <+sburjan> cool anyway :D  
17:06 <+sburjan> will make migration to Se2 much more easier  
17:06 <+tmortagne> sure it's not upgraded yet but before upgrading it I had to do this refactoring  
17:06 <@cjdelisle> Has anyone ever asked for an ldap api so that other ldap aware applications could check permissions on XWiki users?  
17:07 <vmassol> cjdelisle: you mean xwiki being an ldap server?  
17:07 <@cjdelisle> Yes, has that been asked for?  
17:07 <vmassol> not that I know of  
17:07 <vmassol> something like atlassian crowd....  
17:07 <+tmortagne> asked no but I tough about it when we listed idea for the GSOC  
17:08 <+tmortagne> but I did not put it after all  
17:08 <@cjdelisle> Ok. I just had a thought about permissions/auth frontend/backend being connected via ldap  
17:08 <+tmortagne> I thikn i still written it somewhere in design or jira  
17:09 <+tmortagne> I should be pretty easy since LDAP it's basically the same thing, entity containing objects defined by classes  
17:09 <+tmortagne> but that's only if there is reusable server tools/abstract  
17:09 <+tmortagne> I think Apache DS provide something like that  
17:10 <vmassol> IMO xwiki is rarely the centrepiece of an infrastructure so I'd say the use case is low. Supporting openid and other protocols so that xwiki can connect to a SSO system sounds a larger use case to me  
17:11 <vmassol> got to go, bbl  
17:11 <+tmortagne> yep I also think it would not very used  a lot  
17:11 <@cjdelisle> I like that as a general pattern because we end up with modules connected together by standards complicant protocols, if XWiki works then ldap works (ease of testing), and in the rare event that someone wants to query XWiki users, they have a standards compliant method available to them.  
17:11 <+tmortagne> s/very/be/  
17:12 <@cjdelisle> I admit though that in the case of ldap, the case is pretty weak.  
17:22 <sburjan> has quit  
17:26 <Enygma`> has quit  
17:38 <lucaa> has quit  
19:04 <jvdrean> has quit  
19:37 <DrLou> has quit  
19:38 <tmortagne> has quit  
20:07 <mflorea> has quit  
20:13 <vmassol> bad bad: https://www.ohloh.net/p/xwiki/contributors/294205713991  
20:13 <vmassol> someone committed on git "XWiki CI" username  
20:13 <vmassol> I'm trying to fix ohloh: 1006279 lines removed....  
20:13 <vmassol> https://www.ohloh.net/p/xwiki  
20:14 <vmassol> but I fear that our git move is not going to make it happy  
20:14 <vmassol> right now I've removed the svn enlistemetns which were failing and making the git enlistements not be takne into account  
20:14 <vmassol> we need to wait a bit for ohloh to adjust now  
20:15 <vmassol> it's adjusted already a bit  
20:15 <vmassol> now we only have 4074 lines removed  
20:16 <vmassol> hmm the graph looks strange: https://www.ohloh.net/p/xwiki  
20:16 <vmassol> between march and april, that's when we moved togit  
20:22 <vmassol> has quit  
20:23 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
21:34 <pturcotte> has quit  
21:38 <pturcotte> has joined #xwiki  
22:10 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
22:57 <RenJuan> the images in the wikimanager sa version (3.1) seem to be missing. Are you supposed to supply your own? The ones in the table header.  
23:33 <pturcotte> has quit  
23:55 <RenJuan> has quit  
23:57 <pgmjsd> has quit
